org.gearvrf

Class GVRNotifications

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRNotifications

  • public final class GVRNotifications
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows non-GL threads to synchronize with GVRMain.onStep(). You might have code that you want to run every frame, but that does not need to run in the GL thread. Using this class gives you access to timing signals, without slowing the GL thread (which would increase the chance of missing frames).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void waitAfterStep()
      Wait for the next after-step event.
      static void waitBeforeStep()
      Wait for the next before-step event.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • waitBeforeStep

        public static void waitBeforeStep()
        Wait for the next before-step event. This method will block until the GL thread receives the next onDrawFrame() call. Since your thread(s) will wake up shortly before GVRMain.onStep(), you should only use this method if you need the tightest possible synchronization with the GL thread. That is, you should use waitAfterStep() if you can: This method can not guarantee immediate wake-up ... and, if you do get immediate wake-up, you will be competing with the GL thread.

      • waitAfterStep

        public static void waitAfterStep()
        Wait for the next after-step event. This method will block until the GL thread is returning from the next onDrawFrame() call: waking non-GL threads here guarantees the least possible competition for CPU time.
